Context:
The George Brown College Work Study Program offers part- time employment opportunities for students, allowing them to work up to 15 hours a week at minimum wage. Students can find job openings with various on-campus departments such as athletics, academic departments, library, etc., by completing a Work Study Program application form with the employer and submitting it to the Financial Assistance Office. Many jobs are advertised on the GBCareers website. Students can commence work once their application is approved. OSAP students must report any income earned during the school year from any source, including the Work Study Program, to the Financial Assistance Office as it may affect their OSAP funding. The Financial Assistance Office provides applications and information.

Contact Information:
- Financial Assistance Office: 416-415-2000
- TTY: 1-877-515-5559
- Email: ask.george@georgebrown.ca

Please note that information on the website is subject to change without notice, and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
